sourceDesc.p: Wellington City Libraries book of typed transcriptions. Spine title "Hadfield, Typescript (amended) letters 1833-1854". Corrected by Gillian Ryan 1960. (page 11)
Re-typed and encoded into TEI by Melissa Bryant, 18.11.15

body.p: As Aleck is going this morning I cannot let him go without sending a few lines to you. I cannot put my hand on any decent paper so pray excuse this. The good people here have made a great many enquiries about you and G. Poor H. Curtis died about ten days ago. Mrs. Hazel is getting better slowly but is still very weak. The school is thin; I must do something soon, I told (Hazel?) yesterday to make me out a list of the absent ones that I may go to the parents about them.

The Sunday school goes on pretty well, we are now altering the classes and putting up some. The church has been very full lately, which is pleasing. I saw the Battesons yesterday for the first time since I returned. Mrs. B. asked after you kindly. I stay by myself a good deal of my time, however I must begin to walk more with G. (Hemsted?) has the scarletina and has been very ill but is now better. Miss Atkins hoped to have found you here when she returned. Caroline sends you a little sampler. She thanks you for your work which you sent. Aleck will be able to tell you anything else. Jane Elton is gone into the hospital. I have not been very well lately but am now quite well. George is not very well but I think it is because the weather has become warmer.

I hope you do not forget us in prayer - I need your prayers. I am tempted by the adversary and have enemies within also, - nevertheless I faint not, knowing that the "foundation of God standeth sure" etc. You have no daily schools now; let your work be prayer. Pray for me at this time especially that I may be thoroughly sanctified and also directed by the Lord, that my life may be spent to His glory, that I may remember that Christ died for me, that I should not henceforth live to myself but to Him.
Remember me to all friends. Thank my father for his letter, give my love to all.
